verses.kjv: Now Jehoshaphat had riches and honour in abundance, and joined affinity with Ahab.
verses.web: Now Jehoshaphat had riches and honor in abundance; and he allied himself with Ahab.
verses.ct: Jehoshaphat became extremely wealthy and highly honored, and he formed an alliance with Ahab through marriage.

verses.kjv: And after certain years he went down to Ahab to Samaria. And Ahab killed sheep and oxen for him in abundance, and for the people that he had with him, and persuaded him to go up with him to Ramothgilead.
verses.web: After some years, he went down to Ahab to Samaria. Ahab killed sheep and cattle for him in abundance, and for the people who were with him, and moved him to go up with him to Ramoth Gilead.
verses.ct: After a few years, Jehoshaphat traveled down to visit Ahab in Samaria. Ahab slaughtered large numbers of sheep and cattle to feast Jehoshaphat and everyone who came with him, and he talked Jehoshaphat into joining him in an attack on Ramoth Gilead.

verses.kjv: And Ahab king of Israel said unto Jehoshaphat king of Judah, Wilt thou go with me to Ramothgilead? And he answered him, I am as thou art, and my people as thy people; and we will be with thee in the war.
verses.web: Ahab king of Israel said to Jehoshaphat king of Judah, “Will you go with me to Ramoth Gilead?” He answered him, “I am as you are, and my people as your people. We will be with you in the war.”
verses.ct: Ahab king of Israel asked Jehoshaphat king of Judah, "Will you go with me to attack Ramoth Gilead?" Jehoshaphat replied, "I'm with you completely — my army is your army. We'll fight alongside you."

verses.kjv: And Jehoshaphat said unto the king of Israel, Enquire, I pray thee, at the word of the LORD to day.
verses.web: Jehoshaphat said to the king of Israel, “Please inquire first for LORD’s word.”
verses.ct: But Jehoshaphat added, "First, let's ask the LORD what he thinks."

verses.kjv: Therefore the king of Israel gathered together of prophets four hundred men, and said unto them, Shall we go to Ramothgilead to battle, or shall I forbear? And they said, Go up; for God will deliver it into the king’s hand.
verses.web: Then the king of Israel gathered the prophets together, four hundred men, and said to them, “Shall we go to Ramoth Gilead to battle, or shall I forbear?” They said, “Go up; for God will deliver it into the hand of the king.”
verses.ct: So the king of Israel gathered 400 prophets together and asked them, "Should we go to war against Ramoth Gilead, or should we hold back?" They all said, "Go ahead! God will hand it over to the king."

verses.kjv: But Jehoshaphat said, Is there not here a prophet of the LORD besides, that we might enquire of him?
verses.web: But Jehoshaphat said, “Isn’t there here a prophet of LORD besides, that we may inquire of him?”
verses.ct: But Jehoshaphat asked, "Isn't there another prophet of the LORD we can consult?"

verses.kjv: And the king of Israel said unto Jehoshaphat, There is yet one man, by whom we may enquire of the LORD: but I hate him; for he never prophesied good unto me, but always evil: the same is Micaiah the son of Imla. And Jehoshaphat said, Let not the king say so.
verses.web: The king of Israel said to Jehoshaphat, “There is yet one man by whom we may inquire of LORD; but I hate him, for he never prophesies good concerning me, but always evil. He is Micaiah the son of Imla.” Jehoshaphat said, “Don’t let the king say so.”
verses.ct: The king of Israel told Jehoshaphat, "There is one more man we could ask — Micaiah son of Imla — but I hate him. He never has anything good to say about me. It's always bad news." Jehoshaphat said, "The king shouldn't talk like that."

verses.kjv: And the king of Israel called for one of his officers, and said, Fetch quickly Micaiah the son of Imla.
verses.web: Then the king of Israel called an officer, and said, “Get Micaiah the son of Imla quickly.”
verses.ct: So the king of Israel called one of his officers and said, "Go get Micaiah son of Imla — quickly."

verses.kjv: And the king of Israel and Jehoshaphat king of Judah sat either of them on his throne, clothed in their robes, and they sat in a void place at the entering in of the gate of Samaria; and all the prophets prophesied before them.
verses.web: Now the king of Israel and Jehoshaphat the king of Judah each sat on his throne, arrayed in their robes, and they were sitting in an open place at the entrance of the gate of Samaria; and all the prophets were prophesying before them.
verses.ct: Meanwhile, the king of Israel and King Jehoshaphat of Judah were sitting on their thrones, dressed in their royal robes, in an open area near the entrance of the gate of Samaria. All 400 prophets were prophesying in front of them.

verses.kjv: And Zedekiah the son of Chenaanah had made him horns of iron, and said, Thus saith the LORD, With these thou shalt push Syria until they be consumed.
verses.web: Zedekiah the son of Chenaanah made himself horns of iron and said, “LORD says, ‘With these you shall push the Syrians, until they are consumed.’ ”
verses.ct: One of them, Zedekiah son of Chenaanah, had made iron horns for himself and declared, "This is what the LORD says: 'With these you will gore the Syrians until they are completely destroyed.'"

verses.kjv: And all the prophets prophesied so, saying, Go up to Ramothgilead, and prosper: for the LORD shall deliver it into the hand of the king.
verses.web: All the prophets prophesied so, saying, “Go up to Ramoth Gilead, and prosper; for LORD will deliver it into the hand of the king.”
verses.ct: All the other prophets agreed, saying, "Attack Ramoth Gilead and you'll succeed! The LORD will hand it over to the king."

verses.kjv: And the messenger that went to call Micaiah spake to him, saying, Behold, the words of the prophets declare good to the king with one assent; let thy word therefore, I pray thee, be like one of theirs, and speak thou good.
verses.web: The messenger who went to call Micaiah spoke to him, saying, “Behold, the words of the prophets declare good to the king with one mouth. Let your word therefore, please be like one of theirs, and speak good.”
verses.ct: The messenger who went to get Micaiah told him, "Look, every single prophet has told the king good news. Please, just agree with them and say something positive."

verses.kjv: And Micaiah said, As the LORD liveth, even what my God saith, that will I speak.
verses.web: Micaiah said, “As LORD lives, I will say what my God says.”
verses.ct: But Micaiah said, "As surely as the LORD lives, I will only say what my God tells me to say."

verses.kjv: And when he was come to the king, the king said unto him, Micaiah, shall we go to Ramothgilead to battle, or shall I forbear? And he said, Go ye up, and prosper, and they shall be delivered into your hand.
verses.web: When he had come to the king, the king said to him, “Micaiah, shall we go to Ramoth Gilead to battle, or shall I forbear?” He said, “Go up, and prosper. They shall be delivered into your hand.”
verses.ct: When Micaiah arrived before the king, the king asked him, "Micaiah, should we attack Ramoth Gilead, or should we hold back?" Micaiah answered, "Oh sure, go right ahead and attack. You'll win. They'll be handed right over to you."

verses.kjv: And the king said to him, How many times shall I adjure thee that thou say nothing but the truth to me in the name of the LORD?
verses.web: The king said to him, “How many times shall I adjure you that you speak to me nothing but the truth in LORD’s name?”
verses.ct: The king snapped at him, "How many times do I have to make you swear to tell me nothing but the truth in the name of the LORD?"

verses.kjv: Then he said, I did see all Israel scattered upon the mountains, as sheep that have no shepherd: and the LORD said, These have no master; let them return therefore every man to his house in peace.
verses.web: He said, “I saw all Israel scattered on the mountains, as sheep that have no shepherd. LORD said, ‘These have no master. Let them each return to his house in peace.’ ”
verses.ct: Then Micaiah said, "I saw all of Israel scattered across the mountains like sheep without a shepherd. And the LORD said, 'These people have no master. Let each one go home in peace.'"

verses.kjv: And the king of Israel said to Jehoshaphat, Did I not tell thee that he would not prophesy good unto me, but evil?
verses.web: The king of Israel said to Jehoshaphat, “Didn’t I tell you that he would not prophesy good concerning me, but evil?”
verses.ct: The king of Israel turned to Jehoshaphat and said, "See? I told you he never prophesies anything good about me — only bad news."

verses.kjv: Again he said, Therefore hear the word of the LORD; I saw the LORD sitting upon his throne, and all the host of heaven standing on his right hand and on his left.
verses.web: Micaiah said, “Therefore hear LORD’s word: I saw LORD sitting on his throne, and all the army of heaven standing on his right hand and on his left.
verses.ct: Micaiah continued, "Then listen to the word of the LORD. I saw the LORD sitting on his throne, with the entire host of heaven standing at his right and his left.

verses.kjv: And the LORD said, Who shall entice Ahab king of Israel, that he may go up and fall at Ramothgilead? And one spake saying after this manner, and another saying after that manner.
verses.web: LORD said, ‘Who will entice Ahab king of Israel, that he may go up and fall at Ramoth Gilead?’ One spoke saying in this way, and another saying in that way.
verses.ct: The LORD asked, 'Who will lure Ahab king of Israel into attacking Ramoth Gilead so that he falls there?' Various spirits suggested different plans.

verses.kjv: Then there came out a spirit, and stood before the LORD, and said, I will entice him. And the LORD said unto him, Wherewith?
verses.web: A spirit came out, stood before LORD, and said, ‘I will entice him.’ “LORD said to him, ‘How?’
verses.ct: Then a spirit stepped forward, stood before the LORD, and said, 'I'll lure him.' The LORD asked, 'How?'

verses.kjv: And he said, I will go out, and be a lying spirit in the mouth of all his prophets. And the Lord said, Thou shalt entice him, and thou shalt also prevail: go out, and do even so.
verses.web: “He said, ‘I will go, and will be a lying spirit in the mouth of all his prophets.’ “He said, ‘You will entice him, and will prevail also. Go and do so.’
verses.ct: The spirit answered, 'I'll go and be a lying spirit in the mouths of all his prophets.' The LORD said, 'You will succeed. Go and do it.'

verses.kjv: Now therefore, behold, the LORD hath put a lying spirit in the mouth of these thy prophets, and the LORD hath spoken evil against thee.
verses.web: “Now therefore, behold, LORD has put a lying spirit in the mouth of these your prophets; and LORD has spoken evil concerning you.”
verses.ct: So here's the truth: the LORD has put a lying spirit in the mouths of all these prophets of yours. The LORD has declared disaster for you."

verses.kjv: Then Zedekiah the son of Chenaanah came near, and smote Micaiah upon the cheek, and said, Which way went the Spirit of the LORD from me to speak unto thee?
verses.web: Then Zedekiah the son of Chenaanah came near, and struck Micaiah on the cheek, and said, “Which way did LORD’s Spirit go from me to speak to you?”
verses.ct: At that, Zedekiah son of Chenaanah walked up and slapped Micaiah across the face. "So tell me," he sneered, "which way did the spirit of the LORD go when he left me to speak to you?"

verses.kjv: And Micaiah said, Behold, thou shalt see on that day when thou shalt go into an inner chamber to hide thyself.
verses.web: Micaiah said, “Behold, you shall see on that day, when you go into an inner room to hide yourself.”
verses.ct: Micaiah replied, "You'll find out the day you're running from room to room, trying to find a place to hide."

verses.kjv: Then the king of Israel said, Take ye Micaiah, and carry him back to Amon the governor of the city, and to Joash the king’s son;
verses.web: The king of Israel said, “Take Micaiah, and carry him back to Amon the governor of the city, and to Joash the king’s son;
verses.ct: The king of Israel ordered, "Seize Micaiah and take him back to Amon, the governor of the city, and to Joash, the king's son.

verses.kjv: And say, Thus saith the king, Put this fellow in the prison, and feed him with bread of affliction and with water of affliction, until I return in peace.
verses.web: and say, ‘The king says, “Put this fellow in the prison, and feed him with bread of affliction and with water of affliction, until I return in peace.” ’ ”
verses.ct: Tell them, 'The king says: Throw this man in prison and give him nothing but bread and water until I come back safely.'"

verses.kjv: And Micaiah said, If thou certainly return in peace, then hath not the LORD spoken by me. And he said, Hearken, all ye people.
verses.web: Micaiah said, “If you return at all in peace, LORD has not spoken by me.” He said, “Listen, you people, all of you!”
verses.ct: Micaiah declared, "If you come back safely, then the LORD has not spoken through me." Then he called out, "Listen to this, all of you!"

verses.kjv: So the king of Israel and Jehoshaphat the king of Judah went up to Ramothgilead.
verses.web: So the king of Israel and Jehoshaphat the king of Judah went up to Ramoth Gilead.
verses.ct: So the king of Israel and King Jehoshaphat of Judah marched out to attack Ramoth Gilead.

verses.kjv: And the king of Israel said unto Jehoshaphat, I will disguise myself, and will go to the battle; but put thou on thy robes. So the king of Israel disguised himself; and they went to the battle.
verses.web: The king of Israel said to Jehoshaphat, “I will disguise myself, and go into the battle; but you put on your robes.” So the king of Israel disguised himself; and they went into the battle.
verses.ct: The king of Israel told Jehoshaphat, "I'll disguise myself before going into battle, but you wear your royal robes." So the king of Israel put on a disguise, and they went into battle.

verses.kjv: Now the king of Syria had commanded the captains of the chariots that were with him, saying, Fight ye not with small or great, save only with the king of Israel.
verses.web: Now the king of Syria had commanded the captains of his chariots, saying, “Don’t fight with small nor great, except only with the king of Israel.”
verses.ct: Now the king of Syria had given strict orders to his chariot commanders: "Don't bother fighting anyone else — focus only on the king of Israel."

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, when the captains of the chariots saw Jehoshaphat, that they said, It is the king of Israel. Therefore they compassed about him to fight: but Jehoshaphat cried out, and the LORD helped him; and God moved them to depart from him.
verses.web: When the captains of the chariots saw Jehoshaphat, they said, “It is the king of Israel!” Therefore they turned around to fight against him. But Jehoshaphat cried out, and LORD helped him; and God moved them to depart from him.
verses.ct: When the chariot commanders spotted Jehoshaphat, they assumed he was the king of Israel and turned to attack him. But Jehoshaphat cried out, and the LORD helped him — God drew the attackers away from him.

verses.kjv: For it came to pass, that, when the captains of the chariots perceived that it was not the king of Israel, they turned back again from pursuing him.
verses.web: When the captains of the chariots saw that it was not the king of Israel, they turned back from pursuing him.
verses.ct: Once the chariot commanders realized he wasn't the king of Israel, they stopped chasing him.

verses.kjv: And a certain man drew a bow at a venture, and smote the king of Israel between the joints of the harness: therefore he said to his chariot man, Turn thine hand, that thou mayest carry me out of the host; for I am wounded.
verses.web: A certain man drew his bow at random, and struck the king of Israel between the joints of the armor. Therefore he said to the driver of the chariot, “Turn your hand, and carry me out of the army; for I am severely wounded.”
verses.ct: But a soldier drew his bow and shot an arrow at random, and it struck the king of Israel in a gap between the sections of his armor. Ahab told his chariot driver, "Turn around and get me out of the fighting — I'm badly wounded."

verses.kjv: And the battle increased that day: howbeit the king of Israel stayed himself up in his chariot against the Syrians until the even: and about the time of the sun going down he died.
verses.web: The battle increased that day. However the king of Israel propped himself up in his chariot against the Syrians until the evening; and at about sunset, he died.
verses.ct: The battle raged on all day. The king of Israel propped himself up in his chariot, facing the Syrians, but around sunset he died.
